title: Home
text:
The Open Source Program Office at UW-Madison distributed an open source survey in Spring 2024 to gauge the usage of open source tools among members of the university community, identify open source projects under development, and to collect feedback on improving the open source environment at UW-Madison.
This site summarizes the findings of the results and allows users to explore how campus community members use open source tools at UW-Madison.

title: Open Source On Campus
text:
Perceptions of Open Source Culture On Campus
We asked survey takers if they felt that having a vibrant open source culture on campus is important and if they felt that UW-Madison has a vibrant open source culture:

“A vibrant OS culture is valuable”“UW-Madison has a vibrant OS culture”



















89% of respondents agreed that “it makes sense for the university to contribute to open source software that is vital to its educational and research enterprise” (11% were “unsure,” and 0% disagreed).


Open Source Training On Campus
22% of respondents said that they have received at least some formal training or education on open source software during their time at UW-Madison. These respondents were distributed by role and affiliation as below:

RoleAffiliation



















87% of respondents said that they “would like to see more training, education, or support for learning how to contribute to open source project” and 73% of respondents expressed interest in potential open source training sessions and workshops organized by the Open Source Program Office.
